greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n = Sum_{b} c_b*b! in the factorial base rewritten by c_b-fold repetition of b, b=1,2,3,....
comment: The integer n has a unique "greedy" representation in the factorial base as n = Sum_{b>=1} c_b*b!, see A007623.
The number of coefficients c_b is A084558(n).

The current sequence starts from an empty string, scans the coefficients c_b in the order b=1,2,3,..., i.e., reads A007623(n) from the least to the most significant position, and appends b c_b times to the string. The resulting string is shown in the sequence as a standard decimal number a(n).
results.author: _Giorgio Balzarotti_ and _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 13 2005
ext: Definition and comment shortened with reference to A007623 - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 30 2010
